<span id="timeDate">è½½å…¥å¤©æ•°...</span><span id="times">è½½å…¥æ—¶åˆ†ç§’...</span><script>    var now = new Date();     function createtime() {         var grt= new Date("21/02/2020 17:38:00");//åœ¨æ­¤å¤„ä¿®æ”¹ä½ çš„å»ºç«™æ—¶é—´ï¼Œæ ¼å¼ï¼šæœˆ/æ—¥/å¹´ æ—¶:åˆ†:ç§’        now.setTime(now.getTime()+250);         days = (now - grt ) / 1000 / 60 / 60 / 24; dnum = Math.floor(days);         hours = (now - grt ) / 1000 / 60 / 60 - (24 * dnum); hnum = Math.floor(hours);         if(String(hnum).length ==1 ){hnum = "0" + hnum;} minutes = (now - grt ) / 1000 /60 - (24 * 60 * dnum) - (60 * hnum);         mnum = Math.floor(minutes); if(String(mnum).length ==1 ){mnum = "0" + mnum;}         seconds = (now - grt ) / 1000 - (24 * 60 * 60 * dnum) - (60 * 60 * hnum) - (60 * mnum);         snum = Math.round(seconds); if(String(snum).length ==1 ){snum = "0" + snum;}         document.getElementById("timeDate").innerHTML = "æœ¬ç«™å·²å‹‰å¼ºè¿è¡Œ "+dnum+" å¤© ";         document.getElementById("times").innerHTML = hnum + " å°æ—¶ " + mnum + " åˆ† " + snum + " ç§’";     } setInterval("createtime()",250);</script>

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.

Quick Start

Create a new post

$ hexo new "My New Post"

More info: Writing

Run server

_[HTML]: Hyper Text Markup Language

$ hexo server

More info: Server

Generate static files

$ hexo generate

More info: Generating

Deploy to remote sites

$ hexo deploy

More info: Deployment
